Title: $|G| + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle a\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle b\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle ab\rangle\right|}$
Content:
Show that for every finite group $G$ and for every elements $a, b \in G$ the following expression
$$
|G| + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle a\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle b\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle ab\rangle\right|}
$$ is even.
AcceptedAnswer: I think I got it. Check it please. If $|G|$ is odd. Obvious. $|G|$ is even. Then let's assume embedding $f:G \rightarrow S_{|G|}$. According to Cayley theorem $g$ maps to the product of $\frac{|G|}{\left|\langle g\rangle\right|}$ independent cycles of length $\left|\langle g\rangle\right|$. In particular $g$ maps to the odd permutation iff $|G|$ is even and $\frac{|G|}{\left|\langle g\rangle\right|}$ is odd. There are either $2$ or $0$ odd permutations among $f(a), f(b), f(ab)$, i.e. there are zero or two odd summands in this sum ($|G|$ is even).

Original_Problem:
Assumption: 
$G$ is a finite group,
$a$ is an element of $G$,
$b$ is an element of $G$,
$\langle a \rangle$ is the cyclic subgroup generated by $a$,
$\langle b \rangle$ is the cyclic subgroup generated by $b$,
$\langle ab \rangle$ is the cyclic subgroup generated by $ab$.
Problem:
Show that the expression 
$$|G| + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle a\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle b\rangle\right|} + \frac{|G|}{\left|\langle ab\rangle\right|}$$ 
is even.
